issue.description: Remove sentence: "It is intended to cover NPDM and_consequential_failure_relationship." ISO standards "do", they do not "intend" !

describes rather than desribes.
However whole definition is weak - it does not really say why it is an And relationship. Change to: The And_state_definition_realtionship is a state_definition_relatioship which asserts that a set of state_definitions all apply.
However writing this makes it clear that the entity lacks context. Which state_definition do they all apply in? (See nks-47).

comment.description: Moved entity in question under State_cause_effect_definition and improved description.

issue.description: Remove sentence: "This can be a diagnostic process." An entity is never a process! Add a note: Relationships between State_definitions may be used to support fault diagnosis.
Use a note tag for the note.
Should it have a role attribute? If not it should be classified instead. The model will not work without one of these.
Remove sentence: "It is intended to cover NPDM and_consequential_failure_relationship." ISO standards "do", they do not "intend" !

The several of subtypes of this entity lack context. An Or relationship may only apply in the context of one state_definition but the model does not make it possible to describe the context. Similarly for And and Xor (why is Xor only between two?) It might be better to declare one attribute from State_definition_relationship that points to State_definition and is then renamed. It should act as the parent in all parent-child cases and as the cause in cause-effect cases. In the case of And and OR, it acts as the context(?).

comment.description: Three entities in question have been made subtypes of State_cause_effect_definition. Attempting to cover the generic cause and effect relationship and then the special cases as from NPDM. Also, improved descriptions added.

issue.description: It is the STEP tradition to order such attributes name then description.
Suggest include name and description attributes. The set of provided subtypes may not be all there are.

The documentation of attributes should be a free standing sentence. For "standard" attributes like these, copy from ISO 10303-41 or other STEP part. (THIS COMMENT APPLIES TO MULTIPLE ATTRIBUTES IN THE MODULE.)
